page.title: 04Kinver Parish Church
page.content:
The Church of St. Peter stands on the cliff high above the village. If you have not got a car it is a steep climb. Originally there was a Norman Church. The present tower was built in the fourteenth century as was the south aisle but there is still the Norman west wall and buttresses. In the church are many more Norman remains. The east end is mainly fifteenth century in the Perpendicular style as is the beautiful chapel on the north side of the chancel. The north aisle is a recent modern addition. There are several tombs and memorials of the Grey Family of Enville and of the owners of Stourton Castle.
The church services are well attended. The vicar lives in the village.
